fields.description: Sometimes Interactive rebase window not opens if I rebasing on current parent commit.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase not starts if rebasing on same commit

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

In the "History" workspace, click on any commit in the tree

There are several panels, one of which shows the commit information: 
- Commit message
- Commit SHA
- Parents
- Author
- Date etc.

Highlight any of the text on this panel and use "apple-C" to copy to the clipboard

Attempt to paste the content somewhere, like a text editor.

 

Expected: The text I highlighted gets pasted

Actual: Something else gets pasted - the commit message, sha, and other info in a tabular format
fields.summary: "copy" keyboard shortcut hijacked in panel showing commit info

fields.description:
When looking at my Stashes, I usually minimize the story directory here. However, when clicking around in my stashes I find that the story folder usually opens again randomly, causing me to no longer see my stashes.

 

I've seen this issue for quite some time now, maybe 6-9 months. I'm on macOS 10.15 and have my SourceTree updated to 4.0.1. I didn't see any mention of this in the 4.0.2 release notes.

!image-2021-03-25-11-08-56-437.png|width=244,height=234!

The dialog cannot be resized so whatever that last option is remains unselectable.

fields.description:
*Problem*

When triggering the `git pull` action in SourceTree, the last option "rebase instead of merge..." falls below a static height for the box and cannot be viewed.

 

*Conditions*

Method of triggering the modal doesn't seem to matter; clicking the button or using the keyboard short-cut.  The OS's screen resolution doesn't seem to matter either.

 

 

*Supplemental Information*

MacOS: **11.2.3

Version: 4.1.0 (237)

Resolution: 3840x2160

[Screenshot (https://imgur.com/DIpTOFV)|https://imgur.com/DIpTOFV]

Seems like a similar rendering issue with modals that's mentioned in SRCTREE-7624
fields.summary: Git pull modal cuts off last option

fields.description:
steps to recreate
right click file
select ignore

modal shows and only three options 
cut off option is selectable but cannot be read

[image of bug here |https://imgur.com/a/1cA48Tq]

[https://imgur.com/a/1cA48Tq]
fields.summary: Mac - ignore modal cuts off option

fields.description:
This appears to have happened since I updated Sourcetree on macOS to version 4.1.0.

Nothing else that I am aware of in my system or setup has changed.  Currently running macOS 11.2.3.


Screenshot added as an example.

!image-2021-03-20-14-50-29-687.png!
fields.summary: Ignore window is sized too small, options are cut off

fields.description:
During a commit with push, I get this error:

git --no-optional-locks -c color.branch=false -c color.diff=false -c color.status=false -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags --set-upstream origin refs/heads/7.x-m1:refs/heads/7.x-m1 

Pushing to https://github.com/beezwax/InspectorPro

remote: Repository not found.

fatal: repository 'https://github.com/beezwax/InspectorPro/' not found

This started occurring after I switched my account settings for GitHub to use OAUTH.

I can successfully push from the command line git.  "git remote -v" shows: 

origin https://github.com/beezwax/InspectorPro (fetch)

origin https://github.com/beezwax/InspectorPro (push)

so the URL is correct and the repository does exist.
fields.summary: Push fails; says repository does not exist

fields.description: Since 4.1.0 the layout of the "options" in the pull dialog is messed up, and it's hard to click the "rebase option". On Catalina 10.15.7 it's just possible to click it, but on Big Sur 11.2.1 it's pretty much impossible. See the attached screenshots.

Since the last update, I'm no longer able to resize the pull dialog/popup of sourcetree anymore.

Because of this I'm also not able to check all the options anymore, some are hidden now. e.g. I think there used to be an option to say that I want to "rebase the and merge".

fields.description:
When no accounts are present, Sourcetree welcomes users with the message

"Mit einem gehorteten Account verbinden" (Connect to a hoarded account)

It should be

"Mit einem gehosteten Account verbinden" (Connect to a hosted account).

Although automatic error correction might not see "gehostet" as valid, I would still consider it as the more meaningful choice. Kind regards!
fields.summary: Translation (DE): Prominent error in Remote welcome screen

In the Diff panel of SourceTree I recently noticed that the line numbers for the new changes are being cut off.  I've tried resizing the panel, the window and maximizing the window, all with no effect.

fields.description:
I use sourcetree dynamic mode. (view->appearance->use macOS system appearance)

And I use macOS dynamic mode.

When macOS changes from light mode to dark mode, the source tree is also changed to dark mode.
Conversely, when macOS changes from dark mode to light mode, the source tree is also changed to light mode.
However, if I shut down the system in dark mode and reboot the system while macOS is in light mode, the source tree is still in dark mode.
Other apps don't work that way. The source tree maintains its final appearance at boot time.
fields.summary: Appearance bug

fields.description:

fields.description: When I first open a repo, the column widths for all columns in the top pane of the history view are sized roughly appropriately so that if I expand the window to the full width of my screen, all columns fit. If I then close the repo and open later, sometimes the "description" column comes back wider, which causes the last (empty?!?) column to scroll off screen. Please do not change column widths arbitrarily, always use either the last set widths for that repo (or for the app), or at the very least make them all fit in whatever size window the user currently has unless they manually change them.
fields.summary: Top pane in history view keeps resizing columns

fields.description:
We use Git over https and we use private repositories for development. These repositories are used to pull private packages and modules for Python and Go Development. In order to enable that we have a global git configuration that performs a url substitution with the url...insteadOf= feature of Git. This replaces [https://github.com/] with a url that contains [https://username:token@github.com/.|https://username:token@github.com/]

Other tools are doing a good job at not showing the token, but SourceTree does not detect the credentials and show them in the GUI, which means that they are visible with someone looking over the shoulder or worse when doing presentations where the audience can capture a screen shot.

This is a critical security issue.
fields.summary: Git tokens not masked in Pull options

fields.description:
!image-2021-03-08-11-47-47-853.png!

A new checkbox was added but the window size was not updated and the user cannot resize the window. This is a serious usability regression.
fields.summary: Regression: Rebase checkbox is almost invisible in 4.1.0

fields.description:
The default value of {{git config core.commentChar}} is {{#}}. It appears that Sourcetree expects this to be the comment character and does not behave well if the value is changed to something else.

When selecting "Rebase children of _hash_ interactively...", there are several rows of "commits" that are not actually commits—they are comments that Git has added to the file it produces when you run {{git rebase --interactive hash}}.

Please respect the value of {{git config core.commentChar}} when parsing the output of {{git rebase --interactive}}.

The solution right now is to temporarily remove my customization of the {{core.commentChar}} value and revert it back afterward.
fields.summary: Respect git config core.commentChar

fields.description:
I'm running sourcetree 4.1.0 (237) and something is causing the Branches sidebar to not expand, when I hover over the Branches heading, the Show label is not appearing, and its not possible to view my branches which is making things unusable

Sounds like a similar issue to:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-7412
fields.summary: Branches sidebar not expanding

!image-2021-03-04-13-37-21-740.png!

It appears looking at the default that the icons *should* still be pushed left, but something has broken the flex rule.

!image-2021-03-04-13-34-49-266.png!

 

By comparison, here's a friends who hasn't updated.

fields.description:

Mercurial installed via homebrew fully working in command line.

ST doesn't recognize the installation folder of mercurial
fields.summary: Sourcetree doesn't detect system Mercurial

fields.description:
The "search" feature in Sourcetree is helpful when looking for specific commits, commits by a specific user, etc. However, another common task is to look for everything _except_ for a certain commit, user, etc.

It would be helpful to have a "negate" checkbox (or something of the sort) with the "search" functionality. I often want to look for all commits by someone _other_ than a specific user (e.g. an automated build user).

See [this|[http://example.com|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42352390/filter-out-authors-in-sourcetree]] for evidence of other people wanting this feature as well. Plus me and my coworker.
fields.summary: Negated search

fields.description:
There are few cases of this where you perform an action such as deleting a stash where the current stashed files view will not clear. So if I deleted that stash and then clicked on a different view, such as the File status Workspace view, it won't switch to it. It shows that I clicked on it (the label for that section is selected), but the active view is not switched over. I have to click on a different view, such as a branch, or History, and then click back to get the switching to work again.

This seems to occur reliably when deleting stashes, but more intermittently during other activities in which the screen has some need to refresh its contents.

 

PS: Affected version dropdown in this issue creator does not offer version 4.1.0 that is not a beta. Just a heads up.
fields.summary: Active view does not refresh after certain activities like deleting a stash

For example: my username on Gitlab is "X99". Most of my projects are located under this default path. Some of them are located under a custom path in order to group them. Sourcetree only shows the latter.

fields.description:
MacOS: 10.14.6 (18G6020)
Sourcetree: 4.0.2 (236)

GIVEN that multiple Bitbucket accounts are added in SourceTree
   AND only one user: 'Terran-Domain7' has permissions to create/access a repository in my `Terran-Domain7` Workspace
   AND the Terran-Domain7 user is logged into SourceTree via Oauth (google)
   AND the private key for Terran-Domain7 is added and active in my local Mac's ssh identities

WHEN I use the SourceTree interface to create a new repo, locally AND remotely
   AND I publish the repo to my remote Workspace `Terran-Domain7`
   AND I open the SourceTree window for the new repo

THEN I am {color:#FF0000}*unable*{color} to fetch from the remote, *{color:#de350b}nor can I{color}* push to the remote
{code:java}
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.{code}
Expected Behaviour:
THEN I am *{color:#00875a}able{color}* to fetch from the remote, *{color:#00875a}and{color}* push to the remote
----

Here is a video in [Google Drive|http://bit.ly/sourcetree-ssh-bug] demonstrating / replicating the issue
fields.summary: Bitbucket Repo created by Sourcetree cannot be accessed

fields.description:
When attempting to create a remote repository from Github (clicking the "New..." menu in the initial application panel, and then clicking "Create Remote Repository"), the following error is displayed:

[Error Message|https://www.evernote.com/l/ACN6R3ORCiJDL4cMO7Ud-4Q8YW68VfrweKs]

Apparently, the OAuth token requested when creating the Github account does not have the appropriate scope to list organizations, causing the population of the Owner dropdown to fail with this message. Once this occurs, even after the message is cleared, the entire application locks and cannot be used - it must be force quit (using CMD+OPT+ESC) to do anything further.
fields.summary: Create Remote Repository from Github Fails

fields.description:
The source tree app crashes on a few of us at least daily.  We opened a ticket on it due to the radar in the error with Apple, but they say the error is on your end.  This is a system error saying that the system has run out of file descriptors. 
{quote}[http://openradar.appspot.com/radar?id=1387401]{quote}
Not sure how to upload a screen shot here with the error.
 
From our  ticket (101314148130):
I managed to get all the information out of this radar and I can confirm the following details: 
The NSPipe instances are not being deallocated immediately when you release them because they had been put into an autorelease pool (indirectly via NSTask) and won't be deallocated until the applicationDidFinishLaunching: callback is done and control returns to the runloop. If you add an autorelease pool to the interior of the loop, then the pipes and file descriptors are cleaned up before the next iteration of the loop.
 
What does this mean for you, you might ask. From Apple's point of view the behaviour is correct and this was confirmed by multiple teams and it resulted in that the radar was closed back in 2013. Since the developer simply blames it on Apple, and Apple said it that what the developer claims as the issue works as intended. 
 
So my advice would be to once again reach out to your developer and ask them to reach out to our Developer Technical Support team for proper code level support. Beyond that I don’t see any solutions for you.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes on a few of us daily with a system error.

fields.description:
Push dialog box can only display 4 branches, so when a repo has more branches, user has to resize the push dialog box. Since the default size seems to be reset every time SourceTree is restarted, user has to resize the window every time he pushes.

Solutions:
 - Remember the widow user-set sizes
 - Make the push dialog bow window bigger so that it display more than 4 branches
fields.summary: Push dialog box always stays in default too small size

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Selecting multiple files forces to preview them all taking a long time to complete, while it is not your intent to preview them.

Expected Result

The settings would have option to not show file content preview when multiple files are selected. The user would be able to select multiple files quickly without seeing preview of the files. You could still preview contents of individual file by selecting only one file.

Actual Result

While selecting multiple files, user ends up waiting for a long time for preview of all files which were selected, while your intent is to do operations on the files instead of previewing their content. There is no option to not show previewing of files when you select multiple files.
fields.summary: Multi-select file no preview option

fields.description: In SourceTree Menu is selected Appearance -> Use macOS System Appearance. System is in Light mode, but the app is in Dark mode. Other apps are correctly use Light mode. Restarting the app and system doesn't help. The bug appeared right after updating to macOS 11.2.

fields.description:
I like to use the commit description as the comment for my deploys.  In earlier versions of SourceTree you could do this.  Now 'Copy' copies the description, who made it, the commit hash, etc.

Copy
Copy SHA-1
Copy Description <-- add this

Thanks.
fields.summary: Right-click Copy on a commit line should have Copy Description option

fields.description:
The "push all tags" option means that de-facto you will never be able to remove  tag in large projects, because it only needs one developer who still has the tag locally to re-create the tag.

This is a nuisance, especially if your workflow includes things like doing CI/CD builds or deployments on tags.

And with such a workflow the workaround of disabling tag creation except for admins is also a nuisance.

My feeling is that "push all tags" definitely should not be the default, and should probably require a warning dialog, like for other potentially disruptive operations like the various `–force` pushes and such.
fields.summary: "Push all tags" is too dangerous for big team projects

fields.description: The extra dialogs are quite annoying to me, asking to confirm that I want to take the action that I just chose to take. This has been suggested before in SRCTREE-1170 & SRCTREE-1393
fields.summary: Allow disabling confirmation dialogs for Reset/Discard

fields.description: Moving an existing tag moves the tag in sourcetree but does not update the status in the repository. The work-flow now is to remove the tag and add the same tag on a new commit.
fields.summary: Move existing tag

fields.description:

When the branch is highlighted, but the branch tree loses focus it switches to the "inactive" pill notification which is not enough contrast on some systems. 

I would think a possible AC would be: if a branch is highlighted always use the primary color whether the right branch tree even when it does not have focus

 

Branch 1

Branch 2    [ 2 ↑ 4 ↓**  ] <– this is what I call the notification pill. 

Branch 3

fields.summary: Some UI bugs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
I have installed Sourcetree on my new Mac and since then it is not detecting uncommitted changes, can anyone help with this, thanks!
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # checkout a branch in Sourcetree
 # Add changes to the branch
 # In Sourcetree, uncommitted changes are not picked up, unless I manually close and reopen the current repository window

h3. Expected Results

Changed added to the branch should be picked up in Sourcetree
h3. Actual Results

Only the first added changes is picked up and no Uncommitted changes are shown
h3. Workaround

manually close and reopen the current repository window
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes are not picked up by Sourcetree

fields.description:
I like the tab view of repos ("Merge all Windows") but could you please add a hot key combination to merge all windows as tabs or an option to save the tab view.

I would be great if after an app restart all repos opens in the tab view again.
fields.summary: "Merge all Windows" improvement

fields.description: It's hard to click on 3 dots button to reveal drop down menu. Please make the clickable area larger. I can't upload screenshots apparently. The button is in the section Pending files
fields.summary: Clickable area is too small for edited files

fields.description:
Menu "Install command line tools" seems to assume write access to /usr/local/bin/stree

 

This is not necessarily the case.

 

Ability to link to /Users/jnp/Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/bin/git seems to be enough (to start git at least, havn't tried more).

 

Xcode is not installed.

 

From system log:

default 14:53:10.206994+0100 Sourcetree open on /usr/local/bin/stree: Permission denieddefault 14:53:10.206994+0100 Sourcetree open on /usr/local/bin/stree: Permission denied
fields.summary: Install command line tools assumes write access to /usr/local/bin/stree

fields.description:
Fails cloning URL, for example [https://git.code.sf.net/p/squirrel-sql/git].Shows error message including:

warning: templates not found /usr/local/git/share/git-core/templates

 

Xcode is not installed.

Sourcetree should/could be able to run on its own.

 

Btw the templates are not needed it seems, I realised because my Sourcetree is not installed in /Applications but it work never the less when setting template dir to standard values (see below).

 

Workaround is adding this to .gitconfig:

[init]

templatedir = <path to sourcetree>/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/share/git-core/templates

 

This seems to be standard:

templatedir = /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/share/git-core/templates
fields.summary: Can't open /usr/local/git/share/git-core/templates if xcode not installed

fields.description:
*Description:* The arrow icon doesn't open a drop-down list  - https://prnt.sc/wcztrb

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open page [https://nibulon.com/data/our-company/awards.html]
 # Click on the arrow icon on the Main Activities item
 # Pay attention  to drop-down list

*Actual results:*

Clicking on the Main Activities item doesn't show the drop-down list

*Expected result:* 

The drop-down list should be opened after clicking on arrow icon

fields.description:
*Description:* the language is changing from english to  ukrainian after opening  the “Main Events” page  - https://prnt.sc/wcy3b3

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open home page: https://nibulon.com
 # Set the language from ukrainian into english in the header
 # Go to the subcategories Main Events https://nibulon.com/news/main-events.html
 # Pay attention to the  language icon in the header

*Actual results:* 

the language is changed from english to ukranian in the header, but menu items  are not translated.

*Expected result:* 

Language shouldn't  be changed after opening Main Events page
fields.summary: Header:  Language is changed after opening  the “Main Events” page

fields.description:
I'm running Big Sur 11.1 (20C69).

When "Launch External Merge Tool" from the resolve conflict menu. The Visual Merge tool windows briefly shows up (so quickly I had to do a screen recording to capture it).

 

!image-2020-12-17-09-25-33-125.png!

 

It then disappears. Files are created, i.e. BACKUP, BASE, LOCAL, REMOTE. But the merge tool is never launched.

I've tried the following:
 * Uninstall/Re-install
 * FileMerge
 * DiffMerge
 * Custom

None will launch.

I haven't found any errors or warnings in the console.

Marking this as critical since I basically have to switch to a different git tool to be productive.

Please let me know what else I can try.

Thanks,

John
fields.summary: Visual Merge (External Merge Tool) does not open in Big Sur 11.1 no matter the tool

fields.description:
I keep SourceTree in my dock since I use it frequently. As I'm sure your developers are aware, the design language for Mac has changed with the release of macOS Big Sur last month.

The SourceTree app icon is not the correct shape to match the other icons now, which makes the app look bad and makes me unhappy.

Please consider updating the app with a new icon soon since Big Sur has been widely available for a while now.

Message saying apple cannot check for malicious code so it will not open it. It has been two weeks since the questions was answered with a successful response. I do not know what has happened within that time but the download no longer works.

Sometimes sourcetree just freaks out and starts consuming 100+ CPU % points without any reason. It stays this way until the application is closed and restarted.

Crash Report in attachment.

fields.description:
There's all these different versions offered at different web pages. This is confusing. If the software is no longer supported by the company, please remove it from those websites. Please make a clear statement that you're not supporting it anymore. Right now there's also an unsigned version floating around that MacOS cannot verify.
 # On the support page for Sourcetree, there's a link to "Download the latest version for MacOS" which links to version 2.5_c
 # On the product page for Sourcetree ([https://www.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree)] , the download link links to version 3.1.2_216
 # On the App website ([https://www.sourcetreeapp.com|https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]) the download links to version 4.0.2_236 and this one is unsigned.
fields.summary: different versions offered for download

Block usage completely

fields.description:
After upgraded to macOS Big Sur(11.0.2),  i found out that newly created file by Qt Creator(4.13.1) in a QT project will not show in "Unstaged files" Window, but it will work normally if the new file are been created with other editor like "Sublime Text", or move it to the folder manually.

!image-2020-12-03-18-13-02-981.png!

 

And in the mean time, it will always show in the terminal by "git status":

!image-2020-12-03-18-13-02-927.png!

 

I don't know if it's related to the macOS upgrade, since i just discover it recently.
fields.summary: Newly created file by Qt Creator will not show in "Unstaged files" Window

fields.description:
Hi community,

 

I apologize if this request is a repeat one. I think it would be very nice to have some ability to add "folders" or "tabs" where we can group some of the repos, example I have more than 40 repos between different projects like: work related or personal ones. Then it would be very useful if I can have "a folder" there we can just drag and drop different repos.

 

At the moment the flat list is ok, but I am seeing some much opportunity to improvements.

[link flat view example|http://yisu.net/sourceTreeFlatView.png]

fields.description:
If you try to branch from a commit whose message starts with square brackets containing two words split with a forward slash, such as

{{[Blah/fix] Some commit message}}

And then you try to create a local branch from that commit, SourceTree misinterprets the text as a remote branch name and thinks the local branch tracks it. When it then refreshes the view, it produces "error 128" messages because there is no remote branch with that name.

To reproduce, create a clean Git repo. Make a first commit. Then make another with the message

{{[Blah/fix] Some commit message}}

Then use SourceTree to branch from this point. Now switch back to master, and right click the new branch. Notice that SourceTree has populated the "push to" items because it thinks there is a remote branch involved. Now choose to delete the branch, and note the "delete remote branch" option is available when it shouldn't be.

This causes huge problems when trying to branch in a repo that does actually have a remote and someone has made a commit using that brackets syntax.
fields.summary: Commit message starting with [Forward/Slash] in brackets causes SourceTree to erroneously track remote on branch creation

fields.description:
Using OAuth / HTTPS on GitHub leads to constant errors on the Remote tab: "The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMOAuth2 error -1001.)"

Background:
 # I can see a list of some repos on the Remote tab, but the error pops up and renders the Remote tab unusable.
 # It has been happening in SourceTree 3 - 4.0.2
 # On macOS Mojave or Catalina (on two different machines)
 # This does not occur when using Basic / HTTPS, but Basic / HTTPS is at the end of life: [https://developer.github.com/changes/2020-02-14-deprecating-password-auth/]
 # 2FA is off on my account.
fields.summary: Using OAuth / HTTPS on GitHubT leads to constant errors on the Remote tab: "he operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMOAuth2 error -1001.)"
